text: William C. Hancock Jr. (known as Billy Hancock) (November 4, 1946 â€“ January 22, 2018) was an American singer, guitarist, bassist and multi-instrumental recording artist. He has made many recordings, primarily in the rockabilly genre but also has a large body of recorded work in rock 'n' roll, blues, jazz, rhythm & blues, and country music. He was known for his songs "Shakin' That Rockabilly Fever" and "Wanted: True Rock 'n' Roll". Hancock died in La Plata, Maryland on January 22, 2018 of complications from cirrhosis at the age of 71. ==References== Category:Musicians from Washington, D.C. Category:Singers from Washington, D.C. title: Billy Hancock
